issue.title: Don't require source archives to contain module files

repository.name: bazel-central-registry
repository.description: The central registry of Bazel modules for the Bzlmod external dependency system.

issue.body:
Bazel only reads the `MODULE.bazel` file checked into the BCR, so the source archive doesn't technically have to contain one. Adding it for projects without such a file upstream is either a hassle or requires a symlink in overlays, which breaks `raw.githubusercontent.com` previews.

Fixes https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/26217

body:
It just occurred to me today that this could be implemented fairly simply by just treating the MODULE.bazel file served from the registry as an implicit overlay. That is, whenever we generate a `RepoSpec` for a module using `http_archive` ([code](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/bzlmod/IndexRegistry.java;drc=35fb97fe269e42be22fcfa81ff6cdfc4b5bc291e;l=475)), _always_ set the MODULE.bazel file from the registry as a [`remote_file_url`](https://bazel.build/rules/lib/repo/http#http_archive-remote_file_urls).

Of course, this means that we need to add overlay support to `git_repository` to be fully on par -- but that shouldn't be hard.

issue.title: Overlay the registry `MODULE.bazel` file on the module repo

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
RELNOTES: Modules backed by `http_archive` or `git_repository` no longer require a MODULE.bazel file to be contained in the source archive.

Fixes #26217

body: I tried this in https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/26332, but this fails on modules with patches applied to the module file to please the very check we want to remove.
Looks like we can get around this by swapping the order in which `http_archive` applies patches and overlays - how breaking would you consider that?

hmm, that's a bit annoying. The order of "overlays before patches" is explicitly documented at https://bazel.build/external/registry#source-json, so it would be fairly breaking. Maybe we do need a dedicated `remote_module_file` attribute on `http_archive` after all. (Can also remove the `workspace_file` and `workspace_file_contents` attributes by now.)

issue.title: [8.4.0] Overlay the registry `MODULE.bazel` file on the module repo

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
RELNOTES: Modules backed by `http_archive` or `git_repository` no longer require a MODULE.bazel file to be contained in the source archive.

Fixes #26217

Closes #26332.

PiperOrigin-RevId: 778139801
Change-Id: Ie1d219ce1c219c8bae7657be929e54b9b467abf9

Commit https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/c5a562b6b5f718b39b8211fa1cf47169cfedb300

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in[Bazel 8.4.0 RC1](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.4.0rc1). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.4.0rc1. Thanks!
